articles.title: Developped Tools
articles.contents:
mFD R Package and associated tutorials
During my PhD, I have developped the mFD R package which computes and plots functional diversity indices üìèüé®

It is currently available on CRAN and Github for the development version.
Its website goes with a set of tutorials to help to go through the functional analysis process. If you have any question about the use of the mFD package, just contact me and I will be happy to help!
Website on the basics of Code Reproductibility in R
During on a project made during a teaching unit done by the FRB-CESAB in Montpellier (December 2021),
two other PhD students and I have build a website on the basics of Code Reproductibility in R üöÄ Lena Klay, Erwan Harscouet and I hope that this PokeReproductibility website can help newcomers in the Reproductibility to understand the key concepts!
Teaching Material to introduce trait-based diversity to bachelor students using R
In this teaching material led by Laura Richardson, we propose a set of one introductory lecture, three practicals in R and one symposium with a poster session, to learn what is functional diversity, how to compute a multidimensional space based on species traits, diverse functional indices and their meaning, based on an ecological question and field data üê†ü™∏
You can find the Teaching material here !
Using this teaching material, students learn how to:
1- Get to know their dataset & traits data using R üîé
2- Learn basic operations of data manipulation and plot using the #ggplot2 package üìâ
3- Develop hypotheses on coral bleaching‚Äôs impact on fish FDü™∏
4- Learn how to build a multi-traits space via PCoA & what it representsüöÄ
5- Compute FD indices & understand their meaningüß†
6- Test their hypotheses using stat testsüßÆ
7- Present their results in a posterüéÜ

articles.title: Camille Magneville, PhD
articles.contents:
Camille Magneville
          
          
          Home
          About
          Research
          Teachings
          Developped Tools
          Scientific Events
          Publications
          ‚ò∞
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Camille Magneville, PhD
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                        Twitter
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        GitHub
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Email
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            While doing my Master degree, I discovered that
            diversity goes beyond species diversity and
            that it could also be seen as the diversity of
            species traits and evolutionary histories
            (functional and phylogenetic facets of diversity). During my
            Master 2 internship, I explored this idea further and
            applied it to the conservation of insular endemic
            mammals.
            Then, My PhD in marine ecology allowed me to concentrate
            on functional diversity, and learn how to
            study it not only by using species characteristics but
            through the study of functional processes
            such as herbivory. I notably focused on exploring how
            functional processes change over short time periods (within
            and between days) which has led me to contribute to the
            development of underwater long-duration cameras and to the
            creation of a new metric that considers these short-term
            temporal variations. Embracing this diverse array of
            approaches has been truly rewarding, and I wish to
            pursue this path further in the future.
            For my current postdoc, I went back to a more global
            approach by studying the drivers of diversity
            facets, in a project whose final aim is to provide
            stakeholders with guidelines on how taxonomic, functional
            and phylogenetic facets of diversity could be encapsulated
            in realistic conservation plans.
            During my PhD, I came to realize that I really
            enjoy and value knowledge sharing, so
            whenever possible, I actively seek opportunities to
            engage in teaching or public outreach.
            Please don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out, and I will respond to
            you as soon as possible!
            See my CV here (Update
            May 2024)
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Camille Magneville, PhD
            
            
              
                
                                    
                    
                      Twitter
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      GitHub

              During my PhD, I came to realize that I really

              Please don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out, and I will respond

              See my CV here
              (Update May 2024)

articles.title: Research
articles.contents:
DRIVERS OF MEDITERRANEAN FORESTS TAXONOMIC, FUNCTIONAL AND PHYLOGENETIC DIVERSITY & ITS EVOLUTION ACROSS FUTURE SCENARIOS (Postdoc - Sept 2023 - August 2026) - with Alejandro Ordonez, Kent Olsen and Jens-Christian Svenning. 
I am beginning a Postdoc at the ECONOVO Center
at Aarhus University (Denmark).
The first goal of my postdoc is to explore the drivers of diversity in Euro-Mediterranean forests, by leading a multifaceted approach considering the taxonomic, functional and phylogenetic facets of diversity and five key taxa of Mediterranean forests. These drivers consider past climate stability, habitat characteristics, disturbances and past and present direct human impact.
Then, once the drivers have been highlighted, we will be able to assess the expected trajectories of each diversity facet in a near future (2100) and study how it will impact carbon sequestration.
Finally, we will focus on diversity hotspots and protected areas to understand how current hotspots and protected areas roles will change in the near future, by looking at their role in safeguarding functionally and phylogenetically vulnerable species and ecosystem processes. We plan to build a website to provide stakeholders with results they could use.
This work is part of the INTEGRADIV
Biodiversa project whose final role is to provide guidelines on how taxonomic, functional and phylogenetic facets of biodiversity could be encapsulated in realistic conservation plans - you can find a video explaining the global aim of the project here.
For a global summary of the first parts of my project during this postdoc,
you can have a look at the poster I presented at the IBS 2024 here.



FUNCTIONAL DIVERSITY OF FISHES IN COASTAL MARINE ECOSYSTEMS AND ITS TEMPORAL VARIABILITY (PhD thesis - 2019 - 2023) - with S√©bastien Vill√©ger and Thomas Claverie. 
I did my PhD at the MARBEC lab at the
University of Montpellier (France). I
developped new tools to estimate the temporal variability of fishes diversity and functional roles based on long-duration cameras approaches. Using these tools, I studied how functional roles varied at within-day and between-day scales in temperate and tropical coastal ecosystems. Then, I assessed how these temporal variations at short temporal scale can affect our perception of Protected Marine Areas effect.
I have found that within-day and between-day variability in species
functional roles is high and that functional processes (such as herbivory or corallivory) are mainly realized during intense activity events. Thus measuring functional processes on short temporal scales can bias their estimation.
My PhD was filled with different experiences. Methodological work through the development of long-duration underwater cameras, the construction of a metric to better assess mobile species abundance on videos & the lead of the creation of a R package to compute and plot functional diversity indices with a team of researchers. I then applied these tools to collect and analyse data, trying to enhance our understanding of within-day and between-day variability in species
functional roles, through fieldwork (Mediterranean Sea and Indian Ocean) and reproducible analyses in R. I also had the opportunity to work with an incredible team of students, who assisted me in these advancements and with whom I enjoyed sharing skills. This exchange of knowledge and ideas - which goes both ways, is essential to my work, that‚Äôs why I also taught courses in statistics and functional ecology.



DIMENSIONS OF THREATENED ENDEMIC MAMMAL DIVERSITY ON ISLANDS IN A CONSERVATION CONTEXT (Msc thesis - Jan 2019 - June 2020) - with Camille Leclerc and C√©line Bellard 
During my Master 2 internship, I worked at the ESE lab in the Biodiversity dynamics and macro-ecology team led by Franck Courchamp. I learned how to use traits to compute functional diversity, and how to compute phylogenetic diversity. I apply these notions, to study the diversity facets of threatened insular endemic mammals to identify priority areas for their conservation. During this internship, I also learned through lab meetings, to see the glass as half full rather than half empty, and to celebrate small successes!

articles.title: Scientific Events
articles.contents:
Conference talks
2022
International Symposium on Coral Reefs (ICRS): A new framework based on synchronised cameras to measure fish abundance 
2021
International Symposium on Coral Reefs (ICRS): Tropical exotic fish are key herbivores in the Mediterranean sea 
R Rencontres 2021: Presentation of the mFD package - Recording of the talk here
Conference posters
2023
International Biogeography Symposium (IBS): Exploring diversity dimensions to protect Euro-Mediterranean forests 
See my poster here
Co-organised workshops
2022
I had the opportunity to co-organise a Workshop on Functional Rarity and Diversity in Ecology led by the FRB-CESAB and the FREE Research Group. During this workshop, we did a practical on the use of the mFD and the funrar R packages.
Co-organisation with: Matthias Greni√© and S√©bastien Vill√©ger
Scientific popularization
2023
I conducted a workshop (Co-facilitated with Valentine Fleur√©) aimed at primary school classes on the use of artificial intelligence to explore ecosystem functioning for World Oceans Day aimed (UMR MARBEC - Sete)
2022
I participated to the ‚ÄúMa Th√®se en 180 secondes‚Äù (Three Minutes Thesis) competition: the goal is to resume the thesis subject in 3 minutes for a non-scientific audience. My colleagues and I had the opportunity to speak in front of about 450 persons, it was an incredible experience! My talk in french here.

articles.title: Teachings
articles.contents:
Teaching is a part of my job that I absolutely love.
Transmitting knowledge, finding new ways to explain key concepts,
and engaging with students also helps me evolve in my research work.
2019 - 2022
Lectures, tutorial groups and practical works (french) for Bachelor and Master
at the University of Montpellier in:
Biology of Organisms
Functional Ecology
Description of data variability
Biostatistics and R coding
2023 - 2025
At Aarhus University (english):
- Guide a Bachelor research project: creation of a research project based on existing data, to make students think and realize the different steps of a research project - literature search, development of hypotheses, data analyses in R, introduction to functional diversity analyses, report redaction.
- (more coming soon)
